derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English salo 'dusky', of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse sǫlr 'yellow', from a base meaning 'dirty'
Old English salh, of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse selja, and Latin salix 'willow'

entry.tran: (肤色，尤指脸色)灰黄色的，菜色的,蜡黄的
entry.def: If a person has sallow skin, their skin, especially on their face, is a pale yellowish colour and looks unhealthy.

example.ex: She had lank hair and sallow skin.
His face was sallow and shiny with sweat.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several Old World shrubby broad-leaved willows having large catkins; some are important sources for tanbark and charcoal
